text: Prague, the capital of the Czech Republic has a local-government structure. Prague is divided into 10 municipal districts (1-10), 22 administrative districts (1-22), 57 municipal parts, or 112 cadastral areas. == Table of districts == Municipal district Administrative district Municipal parts Prague 1 Prague 1 Prague 1 Prague 2 Prague 2 Prague 2 Prague 3 Prague 3 Prague 3 Prague 4 Prague 4 Prague 4, Kunratice Prague 11 (part) Prague 11, Šeberov, Újezd u Průhonic Prague 12 Prague 12, Libuš Prague 5 Prague 5 Prague 5, Slivenec Prague 13 Prague 13, Řeporyje Prague 16 Prague 16 (formerly Radotín), Lipence, Lochkov, Velká Chuchle, Zbraslav Prague 17 (part) Zličín Prague 6 Prague 6 Prague 6, Lysolaje, Nebušice, Přední Kopanina, Suchdol Prague 17 (part) Prague 17 (formerly Řepy) Prague 7 Prague 7 Prague 7, Troja (has been a separate municipal district since 1 January 1992) Prague 8 Prague 8 Prague 8, Březiněves, Dolní Chabry, Ďáblice Prague 9 Prague 9 Prague 9 Prague 14 Prague 14, Dolní Počernice Prague 18 Prague 18 (formerly Letňany), Čakovice (has been part of administrative district 18 since 2007) Prague 19 Prague 19 (formerly Kbely), Satalice, Vinoř, Prague 20 Prague 20 (formerly Horní Počernice) Prague 21 Prague 21 (formerly Újezd nad Lesy), Běchovice, Klánovice, Koloděje Prague 10 Prague 10 Prague 10 Prague 11 (part) Křeslice Prague 15 Prague 15, Dolní Měcholupy, Dubeč, Petrovice, Štěrboholy Prague 22 Prague 22 (formerly Uhříněves), Benice, Kolovraty, Královice, Nedvězí
title: Districts of Prague
